bioghist.p: Meredith Lane joined the Academy in 1999 as Vice President of Biodiversity. In 2000, she was promoted to Senior Vice President of Science. Lane received her Ph.D. in plant systematics from the University of Texas at Austin. Before coming to the Academy, she was a professor at the universities of Colorado, Wyoming, and Kansas, and worked as a National Science Foundation representative to the Environmental Division of the Office of Science and Technology Policy at the White House. While there, she was Study Executive Director for the Biodiversity and Ecosystems Panel of the President's Committee of Advisors on Science and Technology.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a small number of records from the office of Meredith A. Lane. The materials include a copy of an article by Lane entitled "The Homeless Specimen" that was published in the Museum News; correspondence (1999-2000) regarding donations to the Academy, funding of research, and general queries sent to the Academy; and notes and correspondence regarding the design of the John Gould exhibit curated by Leo Joseph and Robert Peck (the exhibit at the Academy was held prior to a 2002 exhibition at the Australian Embassy in Washington D.C.).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
